originalText.text: Dr. Mahajer is one of the best doctors for back I have ever met.  He explains everything and is very conscientious. He treated me when I had severe back pain due to sciatica.  I highly recommend him.

text.text: Dr. Mahajer is one of the best doctors for back I have ever met.  He explains everything and is very conscientious. He treated me when I had severe back pain due to sciatica.  I highly recommend him.

originalText.text: I was impressed with how Dr. Mahajer was able to diagnose my injury quickly using the ultrasound machine.  He was very knowledgeable and explained to me (and my wife) all of my treatment options.  He even went out of his way to make sure he coordinated my labs, further imaging and got me an earlier appointment with the surgeon while I was in the office.

text.text: I was impressed with how Dr. Mahajer was able to diagnose my injury quickly using the ultrasound machine.  He was very knowledgeable and explained to me (and my wife) all of my treatment options.  He even went out of his way to make sure he coordinated my labs, further imaging and got me an earlier appointment with the surgeon while I was in the office.

originalText.text:
I was not particularly impressed with Dr Mahajer. I saw him twice (initial visit and follow-up) and both visits felt rushed. He spent most of the time looking at the computer typing his notes instead of looking at me and listening to me describe my symptoms. He also never answered any of my follow-up questions sent via MyChart.
I inquired if chiropractor adjustment is appropriate with spinal stenosis and he said yes, so I had one and now my condition got worse. Time to switch from Mount Sinai to another clinic!

originalText.text: Dr. Mahajer is a great doctor. He's very patient and extremely personable. I originally went to see him for my hand but left feeling like I've had a full body examination. He took his time to addressing all my question and concerns. I would  definitely recommend him to anyone looking for a knowledgeable carrying doctor

originalText.text: Refused to treat me because he said I wasn't in pain! Not only is this in violation of the oath he swore as a medical practitioner, he had seen me several times before and knew my condition, which he had diagnosed as a pinched nerve in my neck. Now, as a result of his arbitrary and capricious antics, I am forced to find another neurologist,which could take weeks.
